WRITING.TITLE: This ad misspelled alert...
I'm tired of it... It's always about my family, never about me...
WRITING.TEXT: Greetings Reddit, I think I'm done. I can't take it anymore! I have no one to talk to! I'm such a loser, one of my teachers has a strong disliking towards me, I live in my cousin's shadow, and my dad was never there for me... One day at school, I had had it. I was gonna do it. I tried to tell myself that I was being irrational. I went to the counselor. They called my mom. Rather than being supportive or consoling, she got onto me for telling the school, saying that they're going to label me. I wanted to talk to my dad, but he is overseas. He doesn't give enough of a care. I have no one to talk to. I'm a popular guy, and have many friends, too many to count, but yet, I have no one to talk to! My parents and my friends are only concerned for themselves. It's always them, not me... I can't tell you how many times I've been cheated out of birthday celebrations, or have never been called by my dad. I can't do it Reddit!
How would this abandon all of that?

WRITING.TITLE: Personally, I like the new updates to minecraft...
WRITING.TEXT: I've been on minecraft since Alpha. I loved it. I grew with it. I was 10 at the time of classic. Oh the fun! Everyone hates the updates, and so did I for a while. But I'm starting to like them. I think horses and the armor stands give minecraft a medieval feel. What is your stance on the updates?

WRITING.TITLE: Why don't we have slimeblocks in creative?
WRITING.TEXT: We need them. C.nerd.nu is stuck in the olden days without them. With slimeblocks, we can create flying machines. We can venture into the skies of minecraft, we can safely venture into the void. This is the final frontier...

WRITING.TITLE: I'm scared that Minecraft is dieing...
WRITING.TEXT: I feel like the community is dieing. I don't want Minecraft to end. Minecraft is a beacon of hope in the hell that is the gaming world, it is a fresh page that stands out against the all the "GUNZ BLAZIN COD FPS". Minecraft doesn't feel fun anymore. It feels like it's dragging with all the recent updates. What do we do? I don't want minecraft to die!

WRITING.TITLE: User of r/ beermoney. Was recommended to come here. Want to make $4000?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello my good comrades. I'm 14 and am interested in that of a filmmaking career. I want to create top-notch effects, to do this, I feel the only professional tools for me would be The Foundry's Nuke. The thing is, this costs $4000. I've had this dream of becoming a filmmaker for a long, long time, since I was a wee lad! My parents won't allow me to work a real or summer job just yet, so what might I do until then?

WRITING.TITLE: Want to make $4000 in 1-2 years?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm about to be 14, and would like to have a career as a filmmaker. I want my cgi to be top-notch. I want it to be so good, it gets featured on the Cgbros YouTube page. So, I would like to aquire a copy of The Foundry's Nuke. The thing is, this software costs about $4000. My parents won't let me get a job yet, so I've turned to r/beermoney. Being an avid user of the subreddit, I saw how someone went to Vegas on their "beermoney", so if they can go to Vegas, I can get Nuke, how hard can it be? Harder than you think my friends...Vindale looked very attractive, but my hopes were dashed when I found it charges you for the products you test. I turned to swagbucks, which promised $35 per survey, but my hopes were crushed yet again when I realized these offers are only to reel you in, after that you get a survey every two months for only $0.02. I need advice. What might I do?

WRITING.TITLE: (US) I'll be 14 in a while, and would like to start making money...
WRITING.TEXT: I want to start a career as a filmmaker, to accomplish this, I'm going to need to get a copy of The Foundry's Nuke. This vfx and compositing software is used in every film from Gravity, to Star Trek, to Transformers, you name it, Nuke is in it! The thing is, this software costs about $4000. My parents don't really want me working a job yet, so what might I do? Being an avid user of r/beermoney, I've always wanted to try a bunch of paid surveys, and maybe in 1-2 years I could get the money, but I'm afraid of scams, so I really need some advice!

WRITING.TITLE: (US) User of r/beermoney, need a bigger subreddit to answer my question: What are some of r/ personalfinance's favorite paid survey sites?
Is it really possible to earn $75 per survey on vindale?
